alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:56AM MDT until April 16 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. .Melting snowpack will cause river rises and flooding. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, At 21 Feet...the Milk River near Harlem is bankfull. Some minor problems can occur near the river from Chinook to east of Harlem. Impacts quickly increase as the stage goes above 21 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM MDT Wednesday was 23.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 23.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 23.3 feet Friday, April 21. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.9 feet on 03/25/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed or before 10 AM MDT Thursday.Thursday morning at 1100 AM MDT.
